intro: Amsinckia spencerae, commonly known as Spence's fumewort, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, branching stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, and it produces distinctive, elongated seed pods that split open to release seeds. Amsinckia spencerae is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky soils and open habitats.
